Contains common code used by client nakefiles.

Import the supernake and show off!

Imports

packages/docutils/rst, packages/docutils/rstast, nake, sequtils, posix, strutils, parseopt, tables, os, rdstdin, times, osproc, rester, htmlparser, xmltree, strtabs, parseutils

Types

In_out* = tuple[src, dest, options: string]
The tuple only contains file paths.

Procs

proc update_timestamp*(path: string)
Wrapper over utimes from posix, 
proc rst2html*(src: string; out_path = ""): bool
Converts the filename src into out_path or src with extension changed. 
proc change_rst_links_to_html*(html_file: string)
Opens the file, iterates hrefs and changes them to .html if they are .rst. 
proc needs_refresh*(target: In_out): bool
Wrapper around the normal needs_refresh for In_out types. 
proc nimrod_doc*(nim_file, html_file: string)
Runs nimrod doc on the input file, quitting if something goes wrong. 
proc test_rst*(filename: string): bool {.discardable.}

Calls the rst2html.py script to verify rst compilance of a file.

The proc will indicate which files pass the test or not to the user on top of returning the value to the caller.

proc rst2html*(file: In_out)

Converts the rst file to html, setting options in the process if not nil.

Pass in file.src the path to the source rst file, and file.dest should contain the filename for the output. file.options can be nil, if not, it should point to a configuration file which will be loaded before processing the rst file.

Files which don't have file.options will be further processed to modify with change_rst_links_to_html. Those which have a configuration file won't, since the processing might alter the css/xhtml structure badly.

proc find_first_version_header*(node: PRstNode): float
Returns greater than zero if a header node with version was found. 
proc generate_version_constant*(target: In_out)

Scans the src rst file and generates an output C header with a version.

The version is extracted as the first "vDDD" value from section titles.

template glob_rst*(basedir: string): expr
Shortcut to simplify getting lists of files.
